title: A start-up dynamic in a structured company
text: Pros Very nice work environment, very nice collegues. DaWanda knows how to take care of their employees! If you're willing to and show what you can do, you can quickly get responsabilities and learn a lot. We're quite independant in our work, but thanks to a flat hierarchie we can easily get feedbacks from the management on what we do if necessary. Changes based on test & learn processes, and new projects happen quite often, so that we don't get bored! On most of all, we all work on a great product created to empower people to live their passion and stimulate creativity! Cons We are still somehow dependant on a old product which has to be fixed gradually. Depending on the people, the companies values are not understood the same way, this can lead to unpleasant situations. Advice to Management Keep up the good work! They were many improvement these last past months and I believe DaWanda is on a good way :)

title: Good from far, but far from good
text: Pros Work-Life balance A nice looking office The Snuggery The Marketing/PR/Design department: Thanks to you I was part of building the most-loved German brand, and I am very proud of it! The PR: the brand is so strong that no negative glassdoor article will have any influence on the press coverage. The further away from management, the better life is, as is shown in the ratings on Glassdoor Cons The *most successful* people at DaWanda are those who complain the whole time, but stay quiet when the decision makers are in the room. The worst time was when the sale/merger/exit/closure? of DaWanda fell through: The communication in the corridors was awful, everyone knew how much money was put into what, how little is on the bank account, that marketing presentations for investors were overblown, that fake roadmaps to please investors were put in place, bills were not paid, etc. Many people were fired, many left on their own account for better job security, their ethics, and no more negativity. Advice to Management I hope DaWanda is not the next Enron. You need to do so much more in order for the corridor talk to stop (i.e. exchange your most-trusted employees). Although it was at first interesting to hear all the gossip to know what is truly going on, it was at the same time awful and embarrassing to find out that I was working for such a company.
pros: Work-Life balance
cons: The *most successful* people at DaWanda are those who complain the whole time, but stay quiet when the decision makers are in the room.
advice: I hope DaWanda is not the next Enron.

title: I love working at DaWanda
text: Pros I feel like I get the respect I work for. The teams I work with (and the teams I work in) do also feel very family-style - we do care for each other and we all have the same goal: making DaWanda rock. Cons Just like in every company, not literally everybody is as highly motivated as I'd like to have. That's human. Advice to Management Listen a bit more to the employees; slightly raise the number of company events, become slightly more transparent.

text: Pros HR departement is looking after the staff and trying to motivate them. Cons Management doesn't have a long term plan. Strategy changing every month from full spend to budget cuts. Very loud and overcrowded office without air conditioning, at summer over 30C. No standard processes and lack of structures. Employees are coming and going after a few months. title: Disorganised chaos
text: Pros - Apart from a nice office, good work/life balance and friendly colleagues, the main pro was leaving and never having to return. Cons - Senior management unfriendly, distant yet controlling, and seriously lacking in people skills. - Limited and confused direction. - Erratic spending and planning. - A lot of micro-managing from senior management, which created a tense atmosphere. - No clarity or openness - rumours were the only way to find out what was actually going on. - CEOs generally awkward around employees. Advice to Management - More respect for employees. - Senior management should be more approachable. - Have a clear, defined and achievable plan for the future.

title: Tolles Arbeitsklima und viele Chancen
text: Pros Das Arbeitsklima ist sehr gut, nette Kollegen und flache Hierarchien. Jeder engagierte Mitarbeiter bekommt seine Chance sich weiter zu entwickeln, man kann sich aus jeder Position nach oben arbeiten wenn gute Arbeitsleistung erbracht wird. Auch als Praktikant gibt es die Chance auf Festanstellung. Bevor jemand Externes auf eine höhere Position eingestellt wird schaut man erst nach einer internen Nachbesetzung. Absolut fairer Umgang von oben und immer eine offene Tür bei Problemen. Zudem kann man die Erfüllung seiner Aufgaben relativ frei gestalten und neue Vorschläge finden gehör. Von Anfang an wurde mir großes Vertrauen entgegen gebracht und dazu gehört auch flexibles arbeiten. Cons Mittlerweile ist das Unternehmen schon sehr groß und deshalb kennt man nicht mehr jede Kollegin/Kollegen. Die Zusammenarbeit der Abteilungen muss noch verbessert werden. Advice to Management Den neuen Weg der besseren Transparenz beibehalten.

title: Change is good!
text: Pros DaWanda enables creative people to make a living from their skills and passion, a purpose which I find extremely appealing. The business model is based on shared success - DaWanda as a company can only succeed when DaWanda sellers are successful. Therefore, it is encouraging to see that DaWanda has been implementing many changes with the ultimate goal to become a more customer centric organization. Furthermore, it is pretty awesome to work with talented and creative people with so many great ideas and an intrinsic motivation to deliver great customer value. While goals are ambitious and challenging at times, overall, I find my work-live balance to be well intact- due to flexible working hours, the possibility to work from home as well as a general agreement that working overtime should be the exception, not the rule. Cons Change is good and necessary, yet it always creates friction and unfortunately comes with the loss of some good people along the way. Internal communication at DaWanda is far from perfect, yet I see progress - but it’s still a long way to go. This applies also to collaboration between teams which ranges from non-existent to super awesome. I think DaWanda needs to better retain talented people by, among other things, offering guidance on making a career at DaWanda. With more than 200 people working here, it should be possible to provide many people with exiting career opportunities within the company. I see that development plans are being implemented now in many teams which I believe is a step in the right direction. Advice to Management Foster internal collaboration and communication and continue to drive change to make DaWanda an even more customer centric product and company.
